title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.7.11 | 26-12-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya
Chakshurun Meelitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pachatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shri Vasali Gaurabhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya
Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 11th
verse of the 7th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam
Hare guna kshipta matir bhagavan badarayanihi
adhyagat mahadakhyanam nityam vishnujana priyaha
The meaning of this verse is
Shukadeva Goswami, son of Shri Vyasadeva
was not only transcendentally powerful
but he was also very near to the devotees of the Lord
he underwent this study
Great narration Srimad Bhagavatam
Mahadakhyanam
Great narration of the Srimad Bhagavatam
compiled by Vyasadeva
the question was raised
Why did he take the trouble
to study such literature
when he was already liberated?
The answer was?
was a very significant verse, the 10th verse, the Atmarama verse, even liberated souls are
attracted to Srimad Bhagavatam because it describes Krishna who is full of unlimitedly
wonderful qualities. He attracts everyone, all kinds of persons, especially all kinds
of transcendentalists. So, in the purport, Srila Prabhupada explains that according to
the Brahma Vaivartha Purana, another Purana, not this Bhagavata Purana, another Purana,
Srila Sukhdev Goswami was a liberated soul.
Even within the womb of his mother, such a birth is very, very rare. Generally, we
take birth because we are forced by the laws of nature to take birth in order to square
up our karmic reactions from the previous life or previous lives. But a liberated soul
does not have any reaction. So there are higher purposes for which such liberated souls
appear in the world. Srila Vyasa Deva knew that the child after his birth would not stay
at home. Vyasa Deva is a Trikalanya. He knows past, present and future. So he knew the future,
weArthurer and Rectifier , weaชearer, weasor and vysaśvekar. He did not stick with the
future.
He did not seek the present or future. congressional meetings his very deliverance is an papa and
the future of this child was that he would not stay at home as soon as he would be born he would
just leave home and go away therefore vyasa deva impressed upon the child the synopsis of the
bhagavatam so that the child could be made attached to the transcendental activities of the lord
especially describing the personality of goddess activities qualities forms names paraphernalia
aboard all personal features of the absolute truth after his birth that is chukadeva goswami
who appeared as the son of yasa as a liberated soul the child was still more educating
in the subject of the Bhagavatam by recitation of the actual poems, the actual verses of
the Bhagavatam. The idea is that, why is Prabhupada telling this, quoting from the Brahma Vaivarta
Purana? The idea is that generally the liberated souls are attached to the feature of impersonal
Brahman with a monastic view of becoming one with the Supreme Whole. This is the impersonal
Brahman understanding. The aim of such impersonalists is that they want liberation by merging their
self into the Supreme Whole as impersonal Brahman.
But by the association of pure devotees like Vyasa Deva, even the liberated soul becomes
attracted to the transcendental qualities of the Lord. This is what was elaborately
discussed in the previous verse, the 10th verse, the Atmarama verse. By the mercy of
Shri Narada, Srila Vyasa Deva was able to narrate the great epic of Srimad Bhagavatam.
And by the mercy of Vyasa Deva, Srila Shukadeva Goswami was able to narrate the epic of Srimad
Bhagavatam. And by the mercy of Vyasa Deva, Srila Shukadeva Goswami was able to narrate
the epic of Srimad Bhagavatam.
The transcendental qualities of the Lord are so attractive that Srila Shukadeva Goswami
became detached from being completely absorbed in impersonal Brahman and positively took
up the personal activity of the Lord. This we have elaborately discussed in the previous
verse.
The transcendental qualities of the Lord.
The transcendental qualities of the Lord are millions and billions of times more attractive
than the features of the impersonal Brahman.
The impersonal Brahman understanding is in neutral stage. Lowest is the material conception,
where one thinks in terms of material enjoyment, material pleasure, material pleasure, material
gain, material paraphernalia, material existence, material pleasures, that is sense gratification,
etc. etc.
Material enjoyment in upper planets.
But none of these are free from the material miseries, fundamental miseries, janma, mrityu,
jara, vyadi, dukkha, dopa, etc. etc. etc. etc. etc. etc. etc. etc. etc. etc. etc. etc. etc. etc. etc. etc.
toshanudarshanam.
So, above the material conception is the impersonal conception of the absolute truth.
And that is the neutral stage where one is free from the material miseries, or material
concept of life.
But one has not yet perfected.
Perfected.
Perfected.
the realization of the Absolute Truth to the highest degree. So, if somebody mistakes the
Absolute Truth to be only impersonal Brahman, then they cultivate that knowledge and they somehow
try to seek satisfaction of realization of the impersonal feature. There is no variety,
spiritual variety is lacking. There is no material inebriety or material defect in this realization
of the Absolute Truth as impersonal Brahman. But there is no spiritual variety,
spiritual variety. So, Srila Prabhupada says, practically he was thrown from the impersonal
conception of the Absolute, thinking within himself that he had simply wasted so much time
in devoting himself to the impersonal feature of the Supreme. After one comes to know of the
personal feature, you will think, why was I wasting time with this impersonal feature?
Why do they feel like that? Because he realized more transcendental bliss with the personal feature
than the impersonal. This is explained by Srila Rupa Goswami in Bhakti Rasamrita Sindhu.
Srila Rupa Goswami says that the happiness derived by merging into the impersonal
Brahman, the feature of the Absolute, if it can, the happiness of that merging can be compared
to an ocean, then that transcendental bliss derived from realizing the personal feature
is billions and trillions of times greater than the personal feature.
Billions of times more. I'm sorry, it's the other way round. If the transcendental bliss derived from
the personal feature, understanding or realizing the personal feature is compared to an ocean,
then the transcendental bliss of merging into the impersonal Brahman
is billions and trillions of times greater than the impersonal.
not even equal to one drop it is much much less than that very insignificant
so therefore this personal feature has a lot more transcendental bliss to offer
than the impersonal feature from that time when he became realized in the
personal feature after studying the Srimad Bhagavatam from his father

devotees discuss Oh Krishna he was crawling on his knees in the昵ي
yard of Nanda Maharaj and Nanda Maharaj was absorbed in fondling this child. So they think
what have we got to do with some child and some father fondling the child. They think this is all
material description. What they don't realize is Krishna as a supreme personality of Godhead
even when he takes birth in this material world it is transcendental. Janma Karma Chame Divyam.
It is not like the birth of ordinary living entities, conditioned souls. It's not like that.
Nanda Maharaj when he appears in this world to participate in Krishna's pastimes
he is totally liberated soul. He's not a conditioned soul. He has
no attraction for any material dealings. He has absolutely no attraction for material dealings.
Neither Krishna is interested in any material dealings. So nanda Maharaj's attraction for Krishna
is completely transcendental. That is what Srila Prabhupada is telling here. The impersonalists
are unable to evaluate the devotees of the Lord. Thus from time immemorial.
memorial, these two categories of transcendental pilgrims have sometimes been competitors.
They like to keep themselves separate from each other because ultimately impersonal and
personal realizations don't go together. So, Shukadeva Goswami, he became attracted
to devotees after realizing the personal feature and naturally he would keep away from the
impersonals. I'll stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
